API Docs for Sandy 3D Engine haXe Port, ver. 3.1.1

sandy.materials.WireFrameMaterial

type
class
extends
Material
version
3.1
Displays the faces of a 3D shape as a wire frame.

This material is used to represent a kind a naked view of a Shape3D. It shows all the edges with a certain thickness, color and alpha that you can specify inside the constructor

Constructor

new()
parameters
p_nThickness The thickness of the lines.
p_nColor The color of the lines.
p_nAlpha The alpha transparency value of the material.
p_oAttr The attributes for this material.
see
sandy.materials.attributes.MaterialAttributes
Creates a new WireFrameMaterial.

inherited from sandy.materials.Material
Method to call when you want to release the resources of that material (filters, attributes and lreferences to polygons) Shape3D.DEFAULT_MATERIAL Material can't be disposed because might be used for later shape3D creations

filters(__getFilters,__setFilters) : Array<flash.filters.BitmapFilter>

inherited from sandy.materials.Material
The array of filters for this material.

You use this property to add an array of filters you want to apply to this material
To remove the filters, just assign an empty array.

inherited from sandy.materials.Material
Specifies if the material can receive light and have light attributes applied to it. Can be useful to rapidly disable light on the object when unneeded.
